title: Fir Mountain (New York)
text:
Fir Mountain is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in <a href="Ulster%20County%2C%20New%20York">Ulster County</a>, <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>. 
The mountain is part of the <a href="Catskill%20Mountains">Catskill Mountains</a>.
Fir Mountain is flanked to the northwest by <a href="Big%20Indian%20Mountain%20%28New%20York%29">Big Indian Mountain</a>, and to the southeast by <a href="Spruce%20Mountain%20%28Delaware%20County%2C%20New%20York%29">Spruce Mountain</a>.
The east side of Fir Mountain drains into <a href="Esopus%20Creek">Esopus Creek</a>, thence into the <a href="Hudson%20River">Hudson River</a>, and into <a href="New%20York%20Bay">New York Bay</a>. 
The northwest end of Fir Mtn. drains into Elk Bushkill, thence into Esopus Creek.
The west and south sides of Fir Mtn. drain into Biscuit Brook, thence into the <a href="West%20Branch%20Neversink%20River">West Branch</a> of the <a href="Neversink%20River">Neversink River</a>, the <a href="Delaware%20River">Delaware River</a>, and into <a href="Delaware%20Bay">Delaware Bay</a>.
Fir Mountain is within the <a href="Big%20Indian%20Wilderness">Big Indian Wilderness</a> of New York's <a href="Catskill%20State%20Park">Catskill State Park</a>.
